ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class is definitely recommended to anyone in Comparative Literature or Slavic whose focus is on the modern novel (i.e. from the nineteenth century onwards).
In its current form, I would not recommend this class. If the syllabus is re-vamped and the workload reduced, maybe.

I would recommend the course to a fellow student, it offers an opportunity to re-read the Russian classics and become familiar with the key theoretical approaches to the novel. But i would warn a fellow student that the course is very demanding and one should be prepared to work very hard, no exceptions.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course was extremely enlightening and suggested some interesting approaches to the primary literature in my dissertation.
